nodes.bodyText:
Here you'd better refine the compare logic. And handle the empty case better.
For example, if old Sha256Allowed list is null and new sha256Allowed is an empty list, then you should take it as equal, and not invoke update project logic.

I'm curious why need update project when user changes checksums user setting? Since changing checksums didn't cause the gradle model outdated.
I installed the latest 0.62.3 fix, and have a play on spring-boot project, when i changed checksums, it will trigger lots of jobs. Is there any way to optimize it?

nodes.bodyText: no need, you already have access to newPreferences

That seems wrong. You're updating the preferences in the preference listener!
In here only the WrapperValidator should be updated, from the informations available from the Preference object.
The GradleWrapperList should have been transformed into (dis)allowed checksums directly when building the Preference object.
